intro: Sticherus trifurcans, commonly known as the three-branched liverwort, is a small, mat-forming liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leafy structure with a distinctive three-branching pattern in its thallus. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, called gametophores, are often found at the tips of the thallus. Sticherus trifurcans plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
